speaker: Echo Caverns
lines: Moist air smells of iron and old fires.
Your footfalls double and triple; echoes argue about which one is true.
Scratch-marks wander at knee height along the limestoneâ€”something small and quick.
Calcite curtains hang in sheets; water ticks in patient metronomes.
Charcoal hands once painted antlers here; frost adds its own white antlers over time.
A draft moves against you as if the mountain were breathing out a warning.

choices.text: Follow the scratch-marks into a narrow runnel.
Take the painted passage where sigils bloom with frost.
